2.0: On account of the congregation’s honor - For they would have to wait in passive silence [while the Torah was rolled].

17.0: Women's adornments: Spices that they crush in a mortar with which they adorn themselves, that their smell should be pleasant to their husbands.
17.1: Cooking spices: A spice for a pleasant fragrant cooked dish.

18.0: There fell for them precious stones: They brought a voluntary offering from that which they found every morning, when they go out to pick up the manna, as it is stated, "and they picked it up each morning."

19.0: “Just like this shad (breast), a baby tastes several tastes: that the mother eats.
